comment: She gives way too much homework. Her tests are extremely hard for no reason. Her lectures don't even cover the content properly, you basically have to study by yourself. She grades harshly with no extra credit and doesn't work to help the students.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: She cares about everyone doing well, but she goes way too fast and acts like it's the easiest class you'll ever take. If you're good at chem, you should take her, if not stay away from this prof.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: If you get the opportunity TAKE HER! I cannot express how awesome she is. She gave us fill in the blank notes to go along with the lecture, curved the test/final, responds to emails quickly, is extremely available when you have questions, offers extra credit. Chem is not an easy class but she makes it as easy as possible. I couldn't recommend more

Professor Pepple wants her students to succeed and will make herself available to give special office hours to those who are struggling. Her tests are hard(but she curves tests) and you have to earn your grade in this class. You can pass this class if you do all your HW, discussions and take time to study her lecture notes.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Caring

comment: Solid choice for chemistry. Yes, she's fast at first but the lecture notes she gives helps significantly. She's a genuinely nice lady who tries her best to give her students help. Though, the homework is too much, so you really need to time that well. Put in the work and don't forget discussion posts, and you'll be ok. Oh, and you actually learn :)
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Caring

comment: Prof. Pepple is really nice and approachable. Chem 1211 is a very difficult class, especially doing it online, but Prof. Pepple makes the content understandable and engaging. The "Smartwork" Homework system is annoying and sometimes won't relate to the content. If you take good notes and pay attention you can pass this class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Not a terrible teacher or class, would recommend that you attend all classes. also don't wait last minute to complete assignments for her. Overall great teacher just tough course.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Very friendly and genuine. Seemed to try her best to provide adequate notes and examples through her lectures to prepare for the tests. Chem is a hard subject but if you put in the effort to study you will pass. The SI leaders are amazing and you should take advantage of the extra study sessions. Good with communication.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Tests are hard, mostly everyone in my class that I knew didnt make over a C on tests.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Provided all notes needed for every single unit due to being online. Lots of homework due. Provides practice worksheets. Has quizzes and exams.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Caring

comment: Even though taught in a large lecture hall, the notes she gives you to fill out during class are so helpful. The tests were hard, but you just need to study for them. Honestly, the SI Drew helped a lot with learning the material. SI helped a lot, and the teacher was always open to questions.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: As time goes, you appreciate her more. The homework assignments may seem like a lot, but you can complete 3 weeks of work in 1 day. She gives a lot of good handouts for studying. USE SI LEADER. They are so helpful. You also need to study and read the textbook. The textbook is wordy, but helps to read before class. GO TO OFFICE HOURS. Very helpful.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Skip class? You won't pass.--Get ready to read

comment: Signed up for this class in person and it got put online. She doesnt really teach just reads power points with no explanation. Gives tons of homework each week. The only good thing is the test curves
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Pepple was one of my best professors. she is very sweet and caring. she responds to emails very quickly and she is always available for her students outside of the class. In my opinion chemistry is hard and for learning the material you have to practice! so homework was very helpful. If you study well the exams are very easy. Highly recom
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Caring

comment: This class is so hard for no reason, she give a ridiculous amount of hw due before the test and wont teach it to you before she assigns it. The SI session will help, but I would avoid her class anyway not worth the struggle. Only reason I passed was because the class went online and I could use Chegg on the test. Just take Chem on main campus.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: She is really willing to help her students so that they past. The test are hard but this is already a hard class. I recommend going to any SI session that you can for extra help along with going to the prof's office hours too. Easy to get in contact with. BUT there's A LOT of hw. 80-60+ questions per homework but you get a few weeks to complete it.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor provides mixed information, so if she says one thing, don't believe the hype. Homework assignments (50+ or more) can't be helped, so don't get lazy. Don't recommend taking online, because the department she's under can be a mess (if not already). Seriously, the physics department is much better, so take at your own risk.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: If ya ask, you will receive, that is a good answer. Make sure, if you have any questions, to ask her in person, one on one. Lecture wise, can be solid. Will speed up, the close you get to finishing the section, so if your thinking about raising your hand to ask something, you might want to put it right back down. That's good energy wasted buddy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I do not recommend taking her class, her lectures are SOO boring, and I remember falling asleep so many times. She has approx. 60 page exam study guide that she goes through which is really hard to follow because she goes too fast. Her homework are 70+ questions due before the exam. DO NOT RECOMMEND! DON'T TAKE HER CLASS
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--So many papers

comment: Professor Pepple is honestly one of the best teachers Ive ever had. She genuinely cares about helping the students who put in the work pass with good grades. She always responds to emails and even stays after office hours. She provides thorough notes and is very clear about what is on tests. I was thoroughly prepared for the ACS exam.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Caring

comment: Pepple is a nice lady but she gives out way too much hw 70+ questions that are due before the test, she makes you use guided notes which for me personally are not helpful she moves too fast for normal notes, and the test questions are usually written poorly. She does give generous curves because the majority of class fail because the lectures suck.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: I took Pepple last year (Fall 2018) for Chem 1. Pepple is a kind and caring teacher; she provides ample resources on D2L for students to succeed on the test, and posts all the notes. If you do the practice quizzes on D2L, you'll be prepared for the tests (the questions are quite similar). The online homework can be tedious, otherwise great class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Caring

comment: Professor Pepple is sweet, but not a good lecture hall professor. Her tests are really hard but with generous curves which allow about 15/115 people to get As. Lots of online homework that is super challenging and lengthy. She makes herself very available to students and is excellent in one-on-one and small group work. Prepares well for the final.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Pepple is a tough teacher, but she always wants to make sure you understand. Be prepared to study.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Pepple goes over everything generally in-depth, gives bonus assignments and is very patient and understanding.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Good teacher but doesn't explain how the tests are very well. Also says she "prepares" you for the final but she really doesn't.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: Overall she's a great teacher and person. Chem is a pretty hard subject so she tries to give everyone a chance of passing, which basically means pretty generous curves. Also the test are not as hard as they could be( considering that this is a chem class), and you are sure to pass her class if you put effort into doing the hw and STUDYING.
rating_tags: Participation matters--TEST HEAVY--Caring

comment: she is an amazing teacher who actually cares about her students. She provides all the resources needed to do well in the class!! EXtremelt helpful!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Inspirational--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Pepple is a good professor. She teaches the material well and encourages participation in class. Homework can be a pain but with a study group is easier to understand. If you go to the SI sessions and study you should be good. She also does a good job at helping you if you go to her office hours.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Usually I hate taking classes in lecture halls, but this time it was different. She really cared about all of her students and trully wanted us to succeed. Lectures were very clear and easy to follow, and she was always willing to take questions until everybody understood the material. As long as you show up to lectures and read, you will do well.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I believe Pepple did the best she could with the class she is teaching. Administration makes the class very difficult, not her necessarily. Her notes were solid and for the most part she is understanding and responds well to students. She is honest and very clear with what she expects. The class itself is hard regardless of the teacher.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Awesome teacher. This is a hard class by its very nature and she gives you all the resources you need to pass this class. I had to gap between Chem I and Chem II and am currently reviewing, and this teacher offered to help while on her summer break. If you have a legitimate family crisis during the semester, she will go above and beyond to help.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: She is an overall great person that is willing to go above and beyond to help her students understand Chemistry. If you do the copious amounts of homework and take home quizzes, come to class, and do her "study guides," then you will do fine in this class. She curves the harder tests and the ACS final by a reasonable amount.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS--TEST HEAVY

comment: She's an overall solid professor. She gives out ALOT of busy work, but they are super useful for reviewing for tests. The only times I used the book was for the homework, because sometimes the homework was way harder than her quizzes and tests. She gives major curves to the tests and final grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: I don't even like chemistry like that so as you can already imagine my attention span.. I pretty much just attended lectures, took notes, and use her study guide to pass exams. There will be a state exam, ACS, as the final, forcing you to buy a $25 study guide(not her fault/choice).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Not very helpful, doesn't check email often, goes off on tangents, reads directly from notes, but even when paying attention, it is hard to fill in blanks because she glazes over alot. Was in hospital, explained situation, no leniency on the take home quiz, I made an 89 because of that one grade, don't even ask her to bump you, even if u aced final
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I absolutely adored Dr. Pepple's class. She truly cares about the students and helping them succeed at chemistry. I managed to make an A without any Chem background thanks to her luctures, her office hours, and the SI Sessions. Study your butt off. Put forth effort. You'll at least pass this class since every test was curved.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: There is a lot of material to learn in this class. Take time to learn material such as the 20+ polyatomic ions. This professor gives you fill in the blank notes so you can spend more time listening then trying to just copy. She is great at giving lectures, and I would definetly take her again.

Professor Pepple is a really sweet and caring lady. But speeds through chapters and examples she provides. Extra credit is available but you must go to 10 SI sessions just to receive only TEN points on hw (you must go to all 30 to get 30 extra points). A quiz is due after every chapter, will deduct if no work shown. Passable, but prepare to work
rating_tags: Respected--Tests are tough--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She is a very caring and helpful professor. She goes out of her way to help those who she sees are putting in the effort. There is a lot of homework, but if you do all of it and know the material, you'll do well on the tests. As with all chemistry courses, reading the book is important.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Very boring professor. If you don't want to go to class, you can still do well by self teaching, doing homework and quizzes. Don't slack though. Tests are difficult for the average KSU student. If you are a straight A student its not bad. Don't slack too much or you will miss assignments.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Tough Grader

comment: Bad lectures, goes off on tangents. Makes the class way Harder than the rest of the chemistry professors do. Be careful taking her
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Please take this teacher!! She will teach you chemistry in the simplest way possible. If you have struggled with chemistry in the past, this is the teacher for you. Also, it helps that she is super nice and helpful.

Tons of homework, makes you terrified of the class at the beginning. I have gotten B's on all the tests but I've also cried a lot from stress. She reads straight off her notes and doesn't explain well. So boring I could cry. Made me hate chemistry.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This is chemistry so you can't expect to do well if you don't put in the work. Mrs. Pepple is a good professor and will go out of her way to explain things during office hours or after class. I highly recommend reading the sections from the book that are discussed in class as this is incredibly helpful. There's a ton of HW, so stay on top of it.

Super easy. Probably the easiest chem class. She gives bonus points. Drops lowest test grade. Lots of HW but that every chem class. Attendance is for a grade but its just a note card you can drop off. Sweetest lady ever, she even brought the whole class lemon cake once. If you fail this, you just did not care the,n.
SO much homework, you will be doing homework 6+ hours a day. She is passionate about her students and is such a sweet lady, but her class will kill you. No extra credit.

TAKE HER COURSE!! She's fabulous.. and passionate about her students success. She provides assistance whenever necessary and is always thorough. Her lectures are straight forward, and the material is based from the textbook. So, don't expect to do well if you don't put in any effort to read. I never made anything less than a B.

Expect alot of homework, but she is always willing to help anybody that doesn't understand ask her questions she wont get mad she will fully answer the questions. Just study hard and you will do good.

Gives a lot of homework and a lot of it isn't covered in class. You can tell she use to teach high school by the way she teaches. Gives a "study guide" of what to expect on the test. Speeds through the material so it requires a lot of reading to clearly understand. You have to put in the hard work to earn a decent grade.

Too much homework. You have to spend $60 for a mastering chemistry account to do it, or buy a book that has it. Expect at least 10+ hours a week of homework which is 20% of your grade. This is her first semester teaching college (used to teach in high school) so she follows the rules to a T. Class isn't too hard though if you're willing to work.
